raw.title: [BIP-595] Enable Gauge for sDAI / aUSDC pool on Optimism
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
Payload with PR
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/918

## Summary:

This proposal seeks a Balancer Gauge for an sDAI/aUSDC pool on Optimism, with uncapped emissions. The pool is yield bearing and will be considered a core pool.

The underlying pools are Rehype Pools, an extension of Gyroscope’s E-CLPs. Rehype Pools auto-rehypothecate E-CLP assets to Aave and can thus accrue yield from three different sources: (1) Aave lending deposit yield, (2) swap yields from asymmetric concentrated liquidity, and (3) yield from third-party token incentive markets.

## References/Useful links:

Website: https://spark.fi/

Documentation: https://docs.spark.fi/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/sparkdotfi

## Protocol Description:

Savings Dai (sDAI) is a tokenized representation of Dai deposited in the Dai Savings Rate (DSR) offered by MakerDAO. The sDAI token enables users to receive returns on their DSR deposits while still being able to transfer, stake, lend and use it in any way they want.

sDAI increases in value according to the DSR, as its Dai denominated value gradually increases over time. sDAI is an accumulating token, not a rebasing token. Each sDAI is fungible and always instantly redeemable for DAI.

To acquire sDAI you can deposit Dai and other stablecoins using the [Spark App](https://docs.spark.fi/spark-app/spark-app-user-guide/earning-dai-savings-rate).

## Motivation:

Spark is seeking to establish Balancer and Gyroscope as its primary liquidity sources for sDAI on the Superchain - Optimism and Base. This move aims to enhance the trading experience across the Ethereum ecosystem, making it more accessible for users while generating additional value to the sDAI community.

## Specifications:

Savings Dai (sDAI) is an ERC-4626 representation/wrapper of DAI in the Dai Savings Rate module (DSR). sDAI allows users to deposit DAI to receive the yield generated by the Maker protocol while still being able to transfer, stake, lend and any other use cases. “Swapping” between DAI and sDAI does not need to be done via a DEX but can be achieved by depositing and withdrawing from the DSR module.

**Governance:** Maker DAO is a complex and robust Defi ecosystem. Their current governance module can be seen [here](https://docs.makerdao.com/smart-contract-modules/governance-module).

**Oracles:** This pool relies on the SavingsDAIRateProvider 1 to account for the yield accrued by sDAI. This have been reviewed and deemed SAFE by the integrations team [here](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/pull/50/commits/4f06d0e855478a67e8f936498dc38c46d7d28751).

**Audits:** MakerDAO audit reports can be seen[ here](https://security.makerdao.com/audit-reports). Frax Finance Audits can be seen here.

**Centralization vectors:** Maker Governance is decentralized and has no apparent centralization vectors. The underlying stablecoins USDT, DAI, and USDC are also exposed to their own centralization risks.

**Market History**: sDAI history can be seen on [coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/savings-dai).

**Value:** Yield bearing assets increase the value proposition for liquidity providers, and the revenue for the DAO when properly configured. These pools will grow stablecoin liquidity for Balancer, while tapping into the yield source of sDAI and aUSDC.

### Specifications

sDAI on Optimism: 0x2218a117083f5B482B0bB821d27056Ba9c04b1D3

sDAI/aUSDC Optimism pool on Gyro: [Gyroscope Protocol](https://app.gyro.finance/pools/optimism/e-clp/0x876e0a21626c33bdab879330505eccc6091aa607/)

Child chain gauge: [[Vyper_contract | Address 0xC9B49E2Ae035De1CFA69B4d524A8B5cfedc1a340 | OP Mainnet Etherscan ](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xC9B49E2Ae035De1CFA69B4d524A8B5cfedc1a340)]

Mainnet root: [https://etherscan.io/address/0x9dE7f79Ef7f28447E90051b60aBC5c2b1AdFE1cf]

## Technical Specification:

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): 0x9dE7f79Ef7f28447E90051b60aBC5c2b1AdFE1cf

gaugeType(string): Optimism

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-510] Enable sDAI and sFRAX Gauge [Ethereum & Arbitrum]
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-510] Enable sDAI and sFRAX Gauge [Ethereum & Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/693

**Summary:**
> Balancer's core focus has been yield bearing liquidity for quite some time. As of recent [sDAI](https://app.spark.fi/sdai/) and [sFRAX](https://app.frax.finance/sfrax/stake) have become popular yield bearing stablecoins in the greater defi ecosystem. This proposal is meant to enable four gauges encompassing these tokens on Ethereum and Arbitrum in stable and weighted pools. The pool will sufficiently capture which captures the yield of these tokens and creates routing for the 3 primary stablecoins and wstETH to be swapped against. The pools all will be core for Balancer.

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
    • [Maker Webiste](https://makerdao.com/en/)
    • [Documentation](https://docs.makerdao.com/)
    • [Github Page](https://github.com/makerdao/developerguides/blob/master/dai/dsr-manager-docs/dsr-manager-docs.md)    
    • [Communities](https://forum.makerdao.com/)
> Link to: 
    • [Frax Webiste](https://app.frax.finance/)
    • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-v3/sfrax)
    • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity/blob/master/src/types/constants.ts)    
    • [Communities](https://gov.frax.finance/)


**Protocol Description:**

> sDAI is part of the Maker ecosystem and utilizes the Dai Savings Rate to incentivize users to stake their DAI here https://app.spark.fi/sdai/ . 
>
>sFRAX is from the new Frax v3 ecosystem and can be utilized [here](https://app.frax.finance/sfrax/stake). 

**Motivation:**

> Balancer users will have a more capital efficient place to provide stable coin liquidity routes. As core pools these will receive BAL incentives over time via the BIP-19 cycle. sDAI and sFRAX will overall earn the DAO more revenue and strengthen the routing for swaps on Balancer using the underlying tokens.  

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** Maker DAO is a complex and robust Defi ecosystem. Their current governance module can be seen [here](https://docs.makerdao.com/smart-contract-modules/governance-module). Frax governance is outlined [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-governance/frax-governance-overview). 

2. **Oracles:** This pool relies on the [SavingsDAIRateProvider](https://0xc7177B6E18c1Abd725F5b75792e5F7A3bA5DBC2c) to account for the yield accrued by sDAI. This have been reviewed and deemed SAFE by the integrations team [here](https://github.com/threerocks-defi/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/SavingsDAIRateProvider.md). The sFRAX and wstETH oracles utilize the Chainlink feed factory or have been proven by being utilized for over a year on the platform. 

3. **Audits:** MakerDAO audit reports can be seen [here](https://security.makerdao.com/audit-reports). Frax Finance Audits can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits). 

4. **Centralization vectors:** Maker Governance is decentralized and has no apparent centralization vectors. The underlying stablecoins USDT, DAI, and USDC are also exposed to their own centralization risks.

5. **Market History:** sDAI history can be seen on [coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/savings-dai). sFRAX history can be seen [here](https://www.geckoterminal.com/eth/pools/0xfef79304c80a694dfd9e603d624567d470e1a0e7?utm_source=coingecko&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=searchresults). 
 
6. **Value:** Yield bearing assets increase the value proposition for liquidity providers, and the revenue for the DAO when properly configured. These pools will grow stablecoin and wstETH liquidity for Balancer, while tapping into the yield source of sDAI and sFRAX.

sDAI/3Pool - Mainnet
Pool: [0x49cbD67651fbabCE12d1df18499896ec87BEf46f](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x49cbd67651fbabce12d1df18499896ec87bef46f00000000000000000000064a)
Gauge: [0xF6A7ad46b00300344C7d4739C0518db70e722DC4](https://etherscan.io/address/0xF6A7ad46b00300344C7d4739C0518db70e722DC4)

sDAI/wstETH - Mainnet
Pool: [0x6aa6d7542310cdc75d1179b8729e1e6ec8d42bf1](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x6aa6d7542310cdc75d1179b8729e1e6ec8d42bf100020000000000000000064b)
Gauge: [0x94981eB72dB7EBcAE91ABd5A810f34B1DBf21108](https://etherscan.io/address/0x94981eB72dB7EBcAE91ABd5A810f34B1DBf21108)

sFRAX/4POOL - Arbitrum 
Pool: [0x2CE4457aCac29dA4736aE6f5Cd9F583a6b335c27](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x2CE4457aCac29dA4736aE6f5Cd9F583a6b335c27#readContract)
Child: [0x050fBe33699E56B577c3D6f090eCE9870A0966bd](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x050fBe33699E56B577c3D6f090eCE9870A0966bd)
Root: [0x62A82FE26E21a8807599374CaC8024fae342eF83](https://etherscan.io/address/0x62A82FE26E21a8807599374CaC8024fae342eF83)

sFRAX/wstETH - Arbitrum
Pool:  [0xc757f12694f550d0985ad6e1019c4db4a803f160](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xc757f12694f550d0985ad6e1019c4db4a803f1600002000000000000000004de)
Child: [0xeBF2d1995f9bBEa5CE689945b87CA4B5a033B653](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xeBF2d1995f9bBEa5CE689945b87CA4B5a033B653)
Root: [0xBE0FC6A0cc4eeeB168dfbDA75523c43dFE7D1F9C](https://etherscan.io/address/0xBE0FC6A0cc4eeeB168dfbDA75523c43dFE7D1F9C)

**Specification:**

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xF6A7ad46b00300344C7d4739C0518db70e722DC4`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

gauge(address): `0x94981eB72dB7EBcAE91ABd5A810f34B1DBf21108`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

gauge(address): `0x62A82FE26E21a8807599374CaC8024fae342eF83`
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

gauge(address): `0xBE0FC6A0cc4eeeB168dfbDA75523c43dFE7D1F9C`
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

The pool will have the `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-574] Enable stataOptUSDT/stataOptUSDCn gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/852

> # Summary
>
> * This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for stataOptUSDT/stataOptUSDCn on Optimism.
> * The underlying pool is a Rehype Pool, an extension of Gyroscope's E-CLPs. Rehype Pools auto-rehypothecate E-CLP assets to Aave and can thus accrue yield from three different sources: (1) Aave lending deposit yield, (2) swap yields from asymmetric concentrated liquidity, and (3) yield from third-party token incentive markets.
> * The pool shall have a swap fee of 0.5 basis points, i.e., 0.005% at pool inception. A protocol fee of 30% will be set upon incentives going live. This may be changed later upon mutual discussion (this is a new Rehype pool type and fees and growth may need to be fine tuned). At pool inception, no fees will go towards Gyroscope.

> # References/Useful links
>
> * [Documentation of Rehype pools](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/rehype-e-clps#description-of-rehype-e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

> # Protocol description
>
>* stataOptUSDT is the wrapped, static version of the rebasing Aave lending deposit token for aUSDT. - [Aave](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3)
> * stataOptUSDCn is the wrapped, static version of the rebasing Aave lending deposit token for aUSDC.  - [Aave](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3)


> # Motivation
>
>
> Rehype pools reach new efficiency heights while staying simple and therefore safer. Rehype pools embrace a simple, modular design that doesn't introduce new smart contract code for rehypothecation. Rehype pools thus inherit the security record of E-CLPs. 
>
> The complexity of Rehype pools is handled in the more flexible layers of order routing and front end interface instead of in smart contracts.
At the same time, they keep everything transparent on-chain and keep users in control, in contrast to common rehypothecation in TradFi.
>

> # Specifications
> > ## Governance
> >
> >
> >
> > The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
> >
> >
> >
> > ## Oracles
> >
> >
> >
> > * rateProvider0 (for stataOptUSDT): [0x3f921Ebabab0703BC06d1828D09a245e8390c263](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x3f921Ebabab0703BC06d1828D09a245e8390c263#code)
> > * rateProvider1 (for stataOptUSDCn): [0xdFa8d2b3c146b8a10B5d63CA0306AEa84B602cfb](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xdFa8d2b3c146b8a10B5d63CA0306AEa84B602cfb#code)
> > * (allows to control for a price drift from accruing yield by using rate providers to first convert from yield accruing tokens to the underlying) 
> > * Reviews for these rate providers can be verified as SAFE [here](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/pull/34/files#diff-5861d38cee7220a0b2672cd05e4233e4058bdc3c7c0d4aa1f7a5e00979bfee8b). 
> >
> >
> >
> > ## Audits
> >
> >
> >
> > Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification for the underlying E-CLP can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022. 'Rehype Pools' are an extension of E-CLP that supports Aave's statA tokens and outsources much of the complexity of 'Boosted Pools' to order routers.
> >
> >
> >
> > ## Centralization vectors
> >
> >
> >
> > No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
> >
> >
> >
> > ## Market History
> >
> >
> >
> > The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
> >
> >
> >
> > ## Value
> >
> >
> >
> > As per “Motivation”.
> >
> >
> >
> > ## Contracts
> >
> >
> >
> > * stataOptUSDT/stataOptUSDCn Rehype pool: [0x8BB826Afc0fF7d2c034a2883F4C461ffD238E1C3](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x8bb826afc0ff7d2c034a2883f4c461ffd238e1c3#readContract)
> > * Childchain gauge on Optimism: [0x6EF729bd61dca1B9B52745db37d43503ae0916f9](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x6EF729bd61dca1B9B52745db37d43503ae0916f9#readContract)
> > * Optimism root gauge on Ethereum: [0x1a8F7747cA103d229d7bDFF5f89c176b95Faf301](https://etherscan.io/address/0x1a8F7747cA103d229d7bDFF5f89c176b95Faf301)

> Specification
>
>
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
>
>
> gauge(address): `0x1a8F7747cA103d229d7bDFF5f89c176b95Faf301`
>
>
>
> gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-575] Enable stataArbUSDT/stataArbUSDCn gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/853

> # Summary
> * This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for stataArbUSDT/stataArbUSDCn on Arbitrum.
> * The underlying pool is a Rehype Pool, an extension of Gyroscope's E-CLPs. Rehype Pools auto-rehypothecate E-CLP assets to Aave and can thus accrue yield from three different sources: (1) Aave lending deposit yield, (2) swap yields from asymmetric concentrated liquidity, and (3) yield from third-party token incentive markets.
> * The pool shall have a swap fee of 0.5 basis points, i.e., 0.005% at pool inception. A protocol fee of 30% will be set upon incentives going live. This may be changed later upon mutual discussion (this is a new Rehype pool type and fees and growth may need to be fine tuned). At pool inception, no fees will go towards Gyroscope.

> # References/Useful links

> * stataArbUSDCn is the wrapped, static version of the rebasing Aave lending deposit token for aUSDC on Arbitrum. - [Aave](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3)

> # Motivation

> Rehype pools reach new efficiency heights while staying simple and therefore safer. Rehype pools embrace a simple, modular design that doesn't introduce new smart contract code for rehypothecation. Rehype pools thus inherit the security record of E-CLPs.
> The complexity of Rehype pools is handled in the more flexible layers of order routing and front end interface instead of in smart contracts.
At the same time, they keep everything transparent on-chain and keep users in control, in contrast to common rehypothecation in TradFi.

> # Specifications

For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

> > * Reviews for these rate providers can be verified as SAFE [here](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/pull/34/files#diff-5861d38cee7220a0b2672cd05e4233e4058bdc3c7c0d4aa1f7a5e00979bfee8b). 
>>
> > ## Audits
> > Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification for the underlying E-CLP can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022. 'Rehype Pools' are an extension of E-CLP that supports Aave's statA tokens and outsources much of the complexity of 'Boosted Pools' to order routers.
> > ## Centralization vectors

> > ## Market History

cleaned.title: [BIP-594] Enable Gauges for jitoSOL/SOL and jitoSOL/wstETH on Arbitrum

raw.title: [BIP-594] Enable Gauges for jitoSOL/SOL and jitoSOL/wstETH on Arbitrum
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/917

**Summary:**
Jito proposes a Balancer Gauge for a jitoSOL/wSOL and jitoSOL/stETH pool on Arbitrum, with uncapped emissions. Both pools are yield bearing and will be considered core pools.

**References/Useful links:**
Website: https://www.jito.network/
Documentation: https://www.jito.network/docs/jitosol/overview/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/jito_sol

**Protocol Description:**
Jito is the liquid staking service for Solana that distributes MEV (maximum extractable value) rewards to holders. The Jito Stake Pool enables users to stake their Solana tokens in exchange for a liquid stake pool token (JitoSOL). The JitoSOL token provides liquidity while earning a combination of staking rewards and MEV rewards.

**Motivation:**
Jito is seeking to establish a presence on EVM, utilizing Wormhole technology, with jitoSOL/wSOL and jitoSOL/wstETH pools on Arbitrum as its main liquidity sources to further enrich liquidity for jitoSOL on EVM. This move aims to enhance the trading experience across the Ethereum ecosystem, making it more accessible for users while generating additional value to the Jito community.

**Specifications:**
JitoSOL can be unstaked in between two and four days. Additionally, JitoSOL-SOL is the second most liquid trading pair on Solana, with $30m in TVL as of today across 7 pools. 

**Governance:**

Jito DAO governance is managed by a Discourse forum for conversation, and a Realms interface for executing votes (the Solana equivalent of Snapshot and most popular governance platform on the chain). Links: https://gov.jito.network/ and https://forum.jito.network/ 

The Jito Network and Jito Foundation are controlled by the DAO. It has a constitution with the formal powers but basically the DAO controls all assets in Realms (revenue + JTO), JitoSOL delegation strategy and fees.

A delegation program was started in January with 17 delegates granted 12mm JTO to kickstart governance. There are regular public calls on topical issues.

The first JIP recently passed, changing the JitoSOL Stake Pool delegation parameters. Forum discussion and vote.

Jito hopes to continue increasing governance participation and several more JIPs are expected in the next month.

**Oracles:**
Pyth is the primary oracle, though there are a handful of Switchboard oracles as well.

**Audits:**
jitoSOL is built on the stake pool program developed by Solana Labs. The program has been supporting numerous implementations since the network launched and three firms have completed audits (reports).

Liquid staking non-custodial so Jito does not have access to funds deposited in jitoSOL. Even if Jito were to disappear, holders could still withdraw their SOL from validators along with accumulated rewards.

Jito does have control over validator selection and fees. Jito manages this risk by using a multi-sig operation with over 5 members of the founding team. The majority of the team needs to agree for any changes to take place. Jito will work to diversify the members over time to include other respected constituents from Solana.

**Centralization vectors:**
JitoSOL is built on the stake pool program developed by Solana Labs. The program has been supporting numerous implementations since the network launched and three firms have completed audits (reports).

Liquid staking is non-custodial so Jito DAO or contributors do not have access to funds deposited in JitoSOL. Even if Jito contributors were to disappear, holders could still withdraw their SOL from validators along with accumulated rewards.

The JitoSOL Stake Pool program is currently controlled by a multisig containing several Solana ecosystem contributors. This multisig implements the delegation strategy chosen by DAO. This will migrate to StakeNet so it’s programmatically controlled during Q2.

Jito DAO proposals can be vetoed by a Security Council of five individuals via Emergency Actions. After performing any Emergency Action, the Security Council must issue a full transparency report to explain what was done and why such Emergency Action was justified. The DAO is able to curtail or eliminate the Security Council's power to perform Emergency Actions via approval and implementation of a Jito Improvement Proposal. A handful of the current Security Council members are pseudonymous.

**Value:**
The jitoSOL/wSOL and jitoSOL/wstETH pools on Balancer are intended to serve as a primary liquidity source for the jitoSOL tokens on Arbitrum.

**Specifications:**

decision.summary: This proposal seeks to enable a Balancer Gauge for an sDAI/aUSDC pool on Base to tap yield sources and increase stablecoin liquidity. Voting timeline and power strongly support approval, with mostly neutral forum sentiment and one negative comment. Similar past proposals also enabled gauges but experienced post-vote price and TVL declines, which advises caution. Overall, enabling the gauge aligns with Balancer's long-term value growth goals.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous strong voting power lead for 'Yes, let's do it' option throughout the timeline
Proposal enables yield-bearing liquidity source via sDAI/aUSDC pools, enhancing value for liquidity providers and Balancer DAO
Technical and governance due diligence completed including rate provider review and audits
Similar past proposals had strong vote support, indicating community acceptance of gauge enabling
key_arguments_against: Initial forum comment expressed negative sentiment due to concerns about gauge enabling
Historical similar proposals led to post-vote token price and TVL declines, indicating risk
Underlying stablecoins and yield mechanisms carry some centralization and market risks

evidence.quote: One negative comment initially opposing but proposer confirmed readiness to proceed after rate provider review.
Unanimous 100% lead ratio for option 'Yes, let's do it' with high stability and early voting ratios.

evidence.reference: [BIP-594] and [BIP-593] enabling gauges for other pools
evidence.quote: Both proposals had unanimous vote support but post-vote price and TVL declined, indicating caution for gauge enabling.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline analytics, forum sentiment, and historical lessons rather than ex-post vote tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• Voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for enabling the gauge.
• Forum sentiment mostly neutral with some initial negative concerns but no strong opposition.
• Historical lessons from similar gauge enabling proposals indicate risk due to post-vote price and TVL declines, advising cautious optimism.
• The recommendation aligns with community sentiment and aims to increase yield-bearing liquidity, supporting Balancer's long-term health.
